options.label: D

content: What is encapsulation in OOP?

options.label: A
options.content: It is a way of combining various data members and member functions that operate on those data members into a single unit

options.label: B
options.content: It is a way of combining various data members and member functions into a single unit which can operate on any data

options.label: C
options.content: It is a way of combining various data members into a single unit

options.label: D
options.content: It is a way of combining various member functions into a single unit

content: Which is the correct syntax of inheritance?

options.label: A
options.content: class base_classname extends derived_classname{ /*define class body*/ }

options.label: B
options.content: class derived_classname extends base_classname{ /*define class body*/ }

content: Which of the following best describes member function overriding?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.content: Member functions having the same name and different signature inside main function

options.label: C
options.content: Member functions having the same name and signature in base and derived classes

options.label: D
options.content: Member functions having the same name in base class only

content: Which of these statements about recoverable schedules is true?

options.label: A
options.content: In a recoverable schedule, if a transaction T commits, then any other transaction that T  read from must also have committed.

options.label: C
options.content: In a recoverable schedule, no transaction will ever be aborted because a transaction that it read from has aborted.

content: Which of the following transaction property refers transaction should either be performed in its entirety or not performed at all?

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.content: To ensure data integrity while reading data occurs to the database in a single-user environment

content: Passwords can be used to restrict access to all or parts of the Cisco IOS. Select the modes and interfaces that can be protected with passwords.

A home network has both wired and wireless connectivity. From a laptop computer, the user issues a ping to the wireless printer located in another room. The first two echo requests fail, but the last two succeed. Additional pings are all successful. Why do the first two echo requests fail?

options.label: A
options.content: The computer and the printer must join the wireless network first and that process takes time.

options.label: B
options.content: The distance between the computer and the printer causes delay on the first two pings.

options.label: C
options.content: The wireless printer must be activated and that takes time.

options.label: D
options.content: The computer must use ARP to obtain the MAC address of the printer and this process takes time.

content: During your lunch break, your phone begins to receive unsolicited messages. What might this be an example of?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

content: A network station transmits hundreds of SYN packets to a destination computer. What is the computer doing that sends the message?
